thread.title: Astros fans line up early, rush to get playoff tickets
thread.title_full: Astros fans line up early, rush to get playoff tickets

title: Astros fans line up early, rush to get playoff tickets
text:
Show Transcript Hide Transcript 
RYAN KORSGARD SPOKE TO SOME DO-OR-DIE-HARDS. IT MIGHT BE TOO LATE. I JUST CHECKED AT THE BOX OFFICE. THEY TELL US THEY HAVE ONE TICKET LEFT FOR MONDAY'S GAME. IF YOU LOOK OVER HERE, YOU CAN SEE A SIGN, IT SAYS THAT THEY ARE SOLD OUT FOR SUNDAY, SO IT MIGHT VERY WELL BE TOO LATE. THE RACE FOR THE PLAYOFFS STARTS HERE AT THE TICKET OFFICE AT MINUTE MAID PARK. FANS LINED UP EARLY TRYING TO GET COVETED TICKETS FOR SUNDAY'S GAME IN HOUSTON. JOSE FUENTES' DAD TOLD HIM TO HURRY UP. TUNNELS OUT IT WAS GOOD ADVICE OF ALL SEASON LONG, IT'S BEEN AN UP-AND-DOWN SEASON. AT THE END, I DIDN'T THINK THEY WERE GOING TO MAKE THE PLAYOFFS, BUT RIGHT NOW, WE'RE JUST EXCITED FOR THE PLAYOFFS AND EXCITED TO SEE WHAT THE ASTROS HAVE FOR US. Reporter: HE BOUGHT TICKETS BEFORE SUNDAY AS GAME WAS SOLD OUT. I'VE FOLLOWED THE ASTROS FOR YEARS. NEVER GAVE UP ON THIS MORNING, EVEN THE LAST COUPLE OF YEARS WHEN THEY WEREN'T DOING SO WELL, I WAS STILL HERE. I'M EXCITED THEY BEAT THE YANKEES. Reporter: NOW THEY NEED TO KEEP ON WINNING. SYLVIA BOUGHT TICKETS FOR HER AND HER DAUGHTER. FROM THE KILLER Bs TO TODAY, SHE BELIEVES. I'VE BEEN IN HOUSTON FOR MORE THAN 20 YEARS, AND SINCE THEN, I'VE BEEN LOVING THE ASTROS. Reporter: SUNDAY'S GAME IS SOLD OUT. THEY MAY RELEASE STANDING ROOM TICKETS LATER. NO UPDATES ON THAT JUST YET. HOUSTON - 
Fans lined up early at Minute Maid Park Wednesday trying to get coveted tickets for the Houston Astros playoff game on Sunday. 
Jose Puente's dad told him to hurry! Turns out, it was good advice! By mid-morning, Sunday’s game was sold out. 
Puente said, "All season long it's been an up and down season. At the end, I didn't think they would make the playoffs. Right now we just excited for the playoffs and excited to see the Astros have for us." 
Puente bought tickets and so did long-time Astros fan, Ashley Harlan. 
Harlan told KPRC 2, “I'm a huge Astros fan. Followed them for many years. Native Houstonian. Never gave up on them? Never gave up on them. Even the last couple of years when they weren't doing so well. I was still here at the games. fortunate enough to go see a couple of games outside of Houston. Just excited that they beat the Yankees!" 
Now they need to keep on winning. Sylvia Gonzalez felt like a winner. She bought tickets for her and her daughter. From the “Killer B's” to today...she believes! 
Gonzalez said, "I just love them. I've been in Houston for more than 20 years and since then I’ve been loving the Astros." 
Meanwhile at the Academy on the Southwest Freeway near Kirby, workers scurry to keep the shelves stocked and the new Astros gear out.
